biblStruct.note: Deals with the 11th-century commentary by ʿEli b. Yisrael on the David stories. ʿEli was a Rabbanite, but he was influenced by Karaite scholars, and especially Yefet b. ʿEli. ʿEli has used Yefet’s exegetical techniques, but did so independently, not in the same manner as Yefet, and in many cases he used Yefet’s technique in order to undermine Yefet’s conclusions. It seems that in ʿEli’s time biblical exegesis was still guided by polemics, and therefore ʿEli’s could not lean on Karaite scholars without criticizing their ideas severely, and revising their ideas in order to make them his own. Main MS used for ʿEli b. Yisrael’s commentary is RNL, Yevr.-Arab. I 3361
